data.symptom: --fix mode in code_pipeline corrupted Python files, causing SyntaxError in 10+ files
data.first_bad_boundary: code_refactor.py:remove_unused_imports and sort_imports functions - they replace lines[start_line-1:end_line] but don't properly calculate end_line for multi-line imports
data.actual_cause: Both remove_unused_imports and sort_imports don't properly handle multi-line imports. They read node.lineno but not node.end_lineno, causing partial line replacements that corrupt the import block.
data.fix: Disabled fix operations by setting SAFE_FIX_OPERATIONS = []. Moved remove_unused_imports and sort_imports to UNSAFE_FIX_OPERATIONS with bug notes.
data.prevention: Before enabling auto-refactoring tools, test on codebases with: 1) multi-line imports, 2) parenthesized imports, 3) imports with comments. Add specific unit tests for these cases.
repro_steps:
Project has files with multi-line imports like: from X import (
    A,
    B,
)

recent_change_scan.cleared_reason: Bug existed in original code_refactor.py implementation, not caused by recent changes - this is a design flaw in handling AST multi-line nodes
